text: Johann Heinrich Wilhelm Tischbein, known as the Goethe Tischbein (15 February 1751 in Haina – 26 February 1829 in Eutin), was a German painter. He was from the from the Tischbein family of artists. After 1808, he worked for Grand Duke Peter I. He lived in Eutin until he died. His autobiography, Aus meinem Leben, was not published until 1861. It has been not reissued since. == Gallery == File:Johann Heinrich Wilhelm Tischbein - Goethe in the Roman Campagna - Google Art Project.jpg|Tischbein's most famous painting: Goethe in the Roman Campagna, 1787 File:Tischbein - Lady Charlotte Campbell.jpg|Portrait of Lady Charlotte Campbell File:Johann Heinrich Wilhelm Tischbein - Gänsefamilie und Fuchsfamilie (Metropolitan Museum of Art).jpg|The Duck Family and the Fox Family File:Johann Heinrich Wilhelm Tischbein 003.jpg|Duchess Natalya Saltykova File:Christian Gottlob Heyne Tischbein 1772.jpg|Christian Gottlob Heine File:Diogenes looking for a man - attributed to JHW Tischbein.jpg|Diogenes Searching for an Honest Man == References == == Further reading == * Complete text of Aus meinem Leben @ Google Books (in Fraktur) == Other websites == * Category:1751 births Category:1829 deaths Category:German Lutherans Category:German painters
